alert.note: Alert for Comanche; Eastland (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 29 at 8:25PM CDT until August 29 at 8:45PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central Texas and north central Texas, including the following counties, in central Texas, Comanche. In north central Texas, Eastland. * WHEN...Until 1130 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will likely cause urban and small stream flooding. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in the advisory area. Up to 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are possible. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Eastland, Ranger, De Leon, Gorman, Rising Star and Carbon.
